description: Legacy validation rules for the FAANG project. Rules are divided into one group that is applied to all samples, and additional groups based on the sample type. In addition to rules defined individually, attribute names are imported from the VT, ATOL and EOL ontologies. Legacy samples have less strict metadata requirements, and should only be used for projects that existed prior to FAANGs existence that cannot be brought up to the FAANG metadata standard.  Legacy samples will be clearly marked in the FAANG portal and it may not be possible to include them in all downstream analyses and releases.
name: FAANG legacy sample metadata rules

rules.name: Sample Description
rules.description: A brief description of the sample including species name

rules._comment: Covers organism, specimen from organism, cell specimen, pool of specimens, cell culture, cell line
rules.name: Material
rules.description: The type of material being described.

rules.name: project
rules.description: State that the project is 'FAANG'

rules.name: availability
rules.description: Either a link to a web page giving information on sample availability (who to contact and if the sample is available), or a e-mail address to contact about availability. E-mail addresses should be prefixed with 'mailto:', e.g. 'mailto:samples@example.ac.uk'. In either case, long term support of the web page or e-mail address is necessary. Group e-mail addresses are preferable to indiviudal.

rules.name: Same as
rules.description: BioSample ID for an equivalent sample record, created before the FAANG metadata specification was available. This is optional and not intended for general use, please contact the data coordination centre (faang-dcc@ebi.ac.uk) before using it.

rules.name: Organism
rules.description: NCBI taxon ID of organism

rules.name: Sex
rules.description: Animal sex, described using any child term of PATO_0000047

rules.name: birth date
rules.description: Birth date, in the format YYYY-MM-DD, or YYYY-MM where only the month is known. For embryo samples record 'not applicable'

rules.name: breed
rules.description: Animal breed, described using the FAANG breed description guidelines (http://bit.ly/FAANGbreed)

rules.name: health status
rules.description: Healthy animals should have the term normal, otherwise use the as many disease terms as necessary from EFO

rules.name: birth location
rules.description: Name of the birth location

rules.name: birth location longitude
rules.description: Latitude of the birth location in decimal degrees.

rules.name: birth location latitude
rules.description: Longitude of the birth location in decimal degrees

rules.name: birth weight
rules.description: Birth weight, in kilograms or grams

rules.name: placental weight
rules.description: Placental weight, in kilograms or grams

rules.name: pregnancy length
rules.description: Pregnancy length of time, in days, weeks or months

rules.name: delivery timing
rules.description: Was pregancy full-term. early or delayed

rules.name: delivery ease
rules.description: Did the delivery require assistance

rules.name: Child of
rules.description: Sample name or Biosample ID for sire/dam. Required if related animals are part of FAANG, e.g. quads.

rules.name: pedigree
rules.description: A link to pedigree information for the animal

rules.name: specimen collection date
rules.description: Date at which the specimen was collected

rules.name: animal age at collection
rules.description: Animal age at the point of collection. An estimate is acceptable where the age is not precisely known.

rules.name: developmental stage
rules.description: Developmental stage, any child term of EFO_0000399

rules.name: health status at collection
rules.description: Animal disease / health status at point of collection. Healthy animals should have the term normal, otherwise use the as many disease terms as necessary from EFO

rules.name: organism part
rules.description: Ontology for part of organism specimen from, UBERON is preferred to BTO

rules.name: specimen collection protocol
rules.description: A link to the protocol for specimen collection

rules.name: fasted status
rules.description: Fed, fasted or unknown.  Criteria for this status must be in your protocol

rules.name: number of pieces
rules.description: Number of specimen piecies used

rules.name: specimen volume
rules.description: Specimen volume.  Total sum if using multiple specimen pieces.

rules.name: specimen size
rules.description: Specimen size.  Total sum if using multiple specimen pieces.

rules.name: specimen weight
rules.description: Specimen weight. Total sum if using multiple specimen pieces.

rules.name: specimen picture url
rules.description: A link a picture of the specimen, multiple links allowed

rules.name: gestational age at sample collection
rules.description: If the animal was pregnant when the specimen was taken, state how long had been pregnant for

rules.name: Derived from

rules.name: pool creation protocol

rules.name: specimen volume
rules.description: Pool specimen volume.  Total sum from multiple specimens.

rules.name: specimen size
rules.description: Pool specimen size.  Total sum from multiple specimens.

rules.name: specimen weight
rules.description: Pool specimen weight. Total sum from multiple specimens.

rules.name: specimen picture url
rules.description: A link a picture of the pooled specimen, multiple links allowed

rules.name: cell type

rules.name: Organism
rules.description: NCBI taxon ID of organism

rules.name: Sex
rules.description: Animal sex, described using any child term of PATO_0000047

rules.name: cell line
rules.description: Name of the cell line

rules.description: Name of company or lab that supplied the cell line

rules.description: Identifier for the cell line in the suppliers catalogue. E.g. 'ACC 701' for IPEC-J2 from DSMZ.

rules.name: number of passages
rules.description: The number of times the cell line has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures

rules.name: date established
rules.description: Date the line was established/re-established

rules.name: publication
rules.description: Publication Digitial Object Identifier (DOI) e.g. 'doi://10.1139/o09-005'. Publication where the cell line has been fully described and should include details such as doubling time and adhesion preference. You can use pubmed to find your DOI https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed

rules.description: Brief description of culture conditions (e.g. 'on feeder cells', 'E8 media')

rules.description: Karyotype of the cell line
